text: What is overfitting in machine learning, and name TWO practical ways to reduce it?
correct_answer: Overfitting is when a model fits training data too closely (including noise) and generalizes poorly. Mitigations include regularization (L2/weight decay), early stopping, more data/augmentation, simpler model, dropout, and cross-validation for tuning.
ai_context: Look for: definition (train vs test gap, poor generalization) + two actionable mitigations (e.g., regularization, early stopping, augmentation, simplifying model).

ai_suggestions.text: Clearly defines overfitting and gives two or more valid mitigation techniques with brief rationale.
Defines overfitting correctly and provides at least two mitigations but with limited explanation.
Mentions memorization/generalization but gives only one mitigation or mixes concepts.
